fpmExplorer:Page.title: Adapt i18n Texts
fpmExplorer:Page.introduction: This guide describes how to override standard texts in your generated SAP Fiori elements apps using building blocks.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: 1. Adapt the Manifest to Override the Texts
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Changes must be made in the manifest file of the application. Add 'enhanceI18n' to the settings of the corresponding section as shown in the following code sample:

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: 2. Create an i18n Properties File to Override the Text
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: When you have created your specific application component, for example in SAP Fiori tools, standard texts are available from a specific template component (for example, i18n file within the application folder).

Text.text: 1. If an i18n file is not present, then create a file in the application
2. Add the relevant key and the text to be overridden to the newly created or existing file.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: 3. You Can Now Use the Building Blocks Provided by SAP Fiori Elements
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Example: Using the 'Filter Bar' building block. Add the editing status key to the i18n properties file.
